results.name: Number of steps to reach an integer == 1 (mod 4) when iterating the map n -> 3n/2 if n even or (3n+1)/2 if n odd.
reference: L. Flatto, Z-numbers and beta-transformations, in Symbolic dynamics and its applications (New Haven, CT, 1991), 181-201, Contemp. Math., 135, Amer. Math. Soc., Providence, RI, 1992.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
K. Mahler, An unsolved problem on the powers of 3/2, J. Austral. Math. Soc. 8 (1968), pp. 313-321.
formula: For odd n: a(n)=A007814(n+1), for even n: A007814(n) steps until an odd number is reached, which leads directly to the formula: with b(n)=A007814(n) (binary carry sequence) a(n)=b(n)+b((3^b(n)*n/2^b(n)+1)/2) - Lambert Herrgesell (zero815(AT)googlemail.com) and Lambert Klasen (lambert.klasen(AT)gmx.net), Apr 24 2006. Hence in particular, a(n) is well-defined.
program: (PARI) b(n)=valuation(n,2); a(n)=b(n)+b((3^b(n)*n/2^b(n)+1)/2) - Lambert Herrgesell (zero815(AT)googlemail.com) and Lambert Klasen (lambert.klasen(AT)gmx.net), Apr 24 2006
a063574 n = fst $ until ((== 1) . flip mod 4 . snd)
